newsitem.title: UK: RESEARCH ALERT - Grand Met upgraded.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Grand Met upgraded.

text.p: Merrill Lynch said on Wednesday it had changed its stance on Grand Metropolitan Plc's shares from "hold" to "accumulate" ahead of an analysts briefing on its Pillsbury dough-to-vegetables division.
"We like the change in management," said John Beaumont, analyst at Merrill Lynch, adding he felt the group's current trading was on track.
Its shares were trading up 1/2p at 477-1/2 pence ahead of this morning's meeting.
The shares hit a new high in earlier trading of 485 pence.
Grand Met said Paul Walsh, chief executive of the Pillsbury division, would make the presentation to analysts and institutional investors, providing an overview of strategy as well as general trends.
Other Pillsbury executives will cover marketing, brand devlopment and operations, Grand Met said.
